metadata.Title: CVE-2020-21469 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: ** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in PostgreSQL 12.2 allows attackers to cause a denial of service via repeatedly sending SIGHUP signals. NOTE: this is disputed by the vendor because untrusted users cannot send SIGHUP signals; they can only be sent by a PostgreSQL superuser, a user with pg_reload_conf access, or a user with sufficient privileges at the OS level (the postgres account or the root account).

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. mdeslaur> This is an old issue that was fixed in 2019 upstream

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
